alert.note: Alert for Yukon Flats and Surrounding Uplands (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 15 at 4:51PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR AN ICE JAM NOW IN EFFECT THROUGH TUESDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues to be possible. * WHERE...The Yukon River from the Dalton Highway Bridge to Rampart * WHEN...Through Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...Ice jam flooding is possible between the Dalton Highway Bridge and Rampart. If an ice jam forms, water will rise very rapidly and people may need to evacuate to higher ground at a moments notice. Large ice chunks could also push overbank. Fish camps and other structures along the river could be damaged. Flooding is not expected in the village of Rampart * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A surge of ice and water moving down the Yukon River through the Rampart Canyon may get stopped and jam as it meets in- place ice in the canyon. This surge of water is expected to move from the Yukon River Bridge to Rampart on Tuesday. Flooding is not expected in Rampart. - Http://weather.gov/aprfc - If you live near or along the Yukon River from the Yukon River Bridge to Rampart, stay alert and be prepared to take action.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
